means: 耙地，使耙松( harrow的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: Last night's harrowing television pictures plumbed new depths of depravity.
sentence.Network_cn: 昨晚触目惊心的电视画面堕落到了新低。

sentence.Network_en: "Rid Of Me" is harrowing, uneasy listening.
sentence.Network_cn: 《弃我而去》这首歌非常伤感，听起来很晦涩。

sentence.Network_en: You've had a harrowing time this past month.
sentence.Network_cn: 过去的这个月你过得太痛苦了。

英国老牌名校哈罗公学(Harrow School)发生教师裸照风波，一名美术女教师的半身裸照最近意外流出，迅即遍传校园，校方已要求学 …

entry.tran: 折磨人的;烦人的;令人无比痛苦的
entry.def: A harrowing experience is extremely upsetting or disturbing.

example.ex: You've had a harrowing time this past month.
example.tran: 过去的这个月你过得太痛苦了。

example.ex: ...harrowing pictures of the children who had been murdered.
example.tran: 被杀儿童的那些令人肝肠寸断的照片

auth_sentence.content: The ordeal he had undergone...was so much more harrowing.
auth_sentence.res_content: The ordeal he had undergone...was so much more harrowing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The ordeal he had undergone...was so much more harrowing.

auth_sentence.content: Long journeys can be harrowing in second class carriages.
auth_sentence.res_content: Long journeys can be harrowing in second class carriages.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Long journeys can be harrowing in second class carriages.

auth_sentence.content: For children - it is arguably even more harrowing.
auth_sentence.res_content: For children - it is arguably even more harrowing.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For children - it is arguably even more harrowing.

means.word_mean: 令人伤心的,令人痛苦的

sentences.en: The shipwreck was a harrowing experience.
sentences.cn: 那次船难是一个惨痛的经历。

sentences.en: She told us a harrowing tale of misfortunes.
sentences.cn: 她告诉我们一个悲惨的故事。

sentences.en: I didn’t think I could sit through the film again. It was so harrowing and tore me apart.
sentences.cn: 我觉得自己无法把那部电影再看一遍。故事太悲惨，把我们的心都揉碎了。
